body: The wrong options when dealing with single right answer questions do not count. Thus you do not need to set an id. You can test references to it by right click on the **View** and select option *Find usages*. It is thus safe to remove the ids of the unused **Views**.

When a `RelativeLayout` can be replaced by one `LinearLayout` and the design does not suffer changes, it's good practice to choose the `LinearLayout`. It is less expensive than the relative one :wink:

This layout can be achieved by a vertical `LinearLayout`. Don't forget to also remove the relative specific attributes such as **layout_below**.

You can escape the **[Accessibility] Missing ContentDescription..** warning by setting the **contentDescription** attribute:
```Java
android:contentDescription="@null"
```
This attribute is used to show a descriptive text of the image in case the image does not load. There is little chance of that and you will have apps with hundreds of images, so by setting it *null* you'll at least escape the warning.
Please remove all extra blank lines. Blank lines are used to form code blocks, but in xml files **Views** are pretty clear and well defined, no need for the extra blank lines.
